title: Bangladesh sentences 16 to death over Nusrat Jahan Rafi murder
text:
A court in southern Bangladesh has sentenced 16 people to death over the murder of a student who was set on fire after she accused a teacher at an Islamic seminary of sexual harassment.

Mamunur Rashid, a judge on the Women and Children Repression Prevention Tribunal, read out the verdict in 19-year-old Nusrat Jahan Rafi's murder on Monday.

Rafi died from burn wounds in April after she was doused in kerosene and set alight. The killing sparked protests across Bangladesh.

Speaking a day before the verdict was due, Mahmudul Hasan Noman, Rafi's brother, called for "maximum punishment" against the suspects as 12 of the 16 suspects had confessed to the crime.

AKM Musa Manik, Rafi's father, said he hoped to get justice.

"The whole country had seen what happened to my daughter. She was an innocent girl and was brutally murdered for her strong stance against a wrongdoing."

description: The 19-year-old student was set on fire after she accused a teacher of sexual harassment.
